main_definition: Smoking is primarily known as the act of inhaling and exhaling the smoke produced by burning tobacco or other substances, but it can also refer to various idiomatic expressions related to this action.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The actual physical act of inhaling and exhaling smoke from a cigarette or other source
meanings_and_examples.example: He has been smoking since he was 18 years old.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group of people who regularly meet to discuss matters related to smoking, often advocating for its reduction or cessation
meanings_and_examples.example: The anti-smoking campaign organized a meeting with the local Smoking Club members to strategize their next actions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A device used to burn tobacco and inhale the resulting smoke, commonly known as a cigarette
meanings_and_examples.example: He lit his smoking pipe before taking a seat on the porch.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An informal expression denoting someone's carelessness or lack of attention to detail
meanings_and_examples.example: Don't be so 'smoking', pay more attention to your work!

meanings_and_examples.definition: A colloquial term used as a verb, meaning to talk excessively or in an annoying manner
meanings_and_examples.example: 'He's been smoking the whole time during our meeting!' complained his colleagues.
